title: Interpret interval for mean response time

content.prompt: A 95 percent confidence interval for the mean time, in minutes, for a volunteer fire company to respond to emergency incidents is determined to be (2.8, 12.3). Which of the following is the best interpretation of the interval?

choices.label: Five percent of the time, the time for response is less than 2.8 minutes or greater than 12.3 minutes.
The probability is 0.95 that a randomly selected time for response will be between 2.8 minutes and 12.3 minutes.
Ninety-five percent of the time the mean time for response is between 2.8 minutes and 12.3 minutes.
We are 95% confident that the mean time for response is between 2.8 minutes and 12.3 minutes.
We are 95% confident that a randomly selected time for response will be between 2.8 minutes and 12.3 minutes.

topic.text: 7.3: Justifying a Claim About a Population Mean Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
